document.docAuthor: Machado, Vanessa S. & Monné, Marcela L.
document.docTitle: Macronemus mimus Machado & Monné, 2013, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: The genus Macronemus Dejean, 1835 (Insecta: Coleoptera: Cerambycidae: Lamiinae): two new species, new records and a new synonymy

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The genus Macronemus Dejean, 1835 (Insecta: Coleoptera: Cerambycidae: Lamiinae): two new species, new records and a new synonymy

subSubSection.paragraph: Male. Integument reddish brown to dark brown. Ventral region covered with yellowish and whitish scaly pubescence. Head with yellowish scaly pubescence except spots of dark-brown scaly pubescence near inner margin of lower eye lobe and between upper lobes. Antennomere 11 about 2.5 x longer than 3 . Scape with two bands of yellowish scaly pubescence intercalated with brown scaly pubescence and some spots of whitish scaly pubescence on ventral region near apex; pedicel with yellowish scaly pubescence in dorsal region and whitish scaly pubescence in ventral and lateral regions; antennomeres 3–11 with whitish and yellowish scaly pubescence on apical and basal halves and median band of brown scaly pubescence.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 18–24 .
Macronemus mimus
sp. nov.
18, holotype, male, dorsal view; 19–21, paratypes, male dorsal view; 22, male inner and outer protibial spurs subequal; 23, male inner protibial spur longer than outer; 24, pronotum projections flattened at apex.

FIGURES 25–26.
Macronemus mimus
sp. nov.
paratypes, female, dorsal view.

subSubSection.paragraph: Prothorax about 1.7 x as wide as long. Pronotum with one pair of projections flattened at apex, covered with spots of dark-brown scaly pubescence on outer side of each tubercle and narrow lines of whitish scaly pubescence; coarse and sparse punctures between the tubercles. Scutellum with yellowish scaly pubescence in median region and dark-brown pubescence on margins.

Elytra about twice as long as prothorax; apices rounded; covered with small sparse punctures, and dense coarse punctures between cristae and eye-shaped spots. General scaly pubescence, concolor with body, except narrow lines of whitish scaly pubescence; basal third with two eye-shaped spots of dark-brown scaly pubescence; median region with two spots of dark-brown scaly pubescence (one spot crescent and the other drop-shaped); apical third with two diagonal bands (one of dark-brown and the other of yellowish scaly pubescence) descending toward apex, not reaching suture.
Female. Apex of fifth urosternite deeply excavated.

Measurements, in mm, male/female. Total length, 7.6 –14.0/ 7.8–14.4 ; prothorax length, 1.6–2.8 / 1.6 –3.0; prothorax width, 2.2–4.7 / 2.4–4.7 ; elytral length, 5.3–10.5 / 5.7–10.6 ; humeral width, 2.7–5.8 / 2.9–5.8 .
Etymology . Greek, imitator, the specific epithet refers to the defensive behavior, possibly imitating bird dropping.

Comments .
Macronemus mimus
sp. nov.
(
Figs 18–26
) differs from all other species of the genus in having general scaly pubescence concolor with the body, somewhat uniform; elytral basal third with two eye-shaped spots of dark-brown scaly pubescence; and by the pronotum projection flattened at apex (
Fig. 24
).
Geographical distribution . Brazil (Bahia to Santa Catarina) and Argentina (Misiones).
